H0.text: Thick fur is the adaptation that best helps a large mammal survive in a cold, snowy environment.

H1.text: Sharp claws are the adaptation that would best help a large mammal survive in a cold, snowy environment.

H2.text: Large ears are the adaptation that would best help a large mammal survive in low temperatures in a cold, snowy environment.

H3.text: Strong muscles would best help a large mammal survive in low temperatures in a cold, snowy environment.

A4.text: Arctic mammals, such as the muskox, have guard hairs measuring 30 cm and dense underfur forming an airtight coat that allows them to survive temperatures of −40 °C.

A5.text: Dense fur increases an animal's insulation value, and arctic mammals especially have dense fur.
